definitions: visible scratch, blemish, or defect on a surface
impairment or reduction in value, quality, or appearance through damage
examples: The antique table had a small mar on its polished surface
She carefully buffed out the mar from the car's finish
His reputation suffered a permanent mar after the scandal
Nothing could mar their happiness on their wedding day

definitions: competitive running race covering a standardized distance of 26.2 miles or 42.195 kilometers
prolonged activity, task, or event requiring sustained effort and endurance
examples: She trained for six months to run her first marathon
The Boston Marathon attracts runners from around the world
They had a movie marathon watching all eight films
The negotiations turned into a marathon session lasting twelve hours

definitions: person who roams in search of plunder or victims to attack
examples: The village defended itself against marauders from the mountains
Historical accounts describe Viking marauders raiding coastal settlements
Corporate marauders targeted vulnerable companies for hostile takeovers
The marauders swept through the countryside stealing livestock

definitions: act of roaming in search of things to steal or people to attack
examples: The marauding of bandits terrorized the frontier towns
Farmers complained about the marauding of wild boars
The marauding continued despite increased security measures
Historical records document the marauding of various invading armies

definitions: hard crystalline metamorphic rock formed from limestone, used in sculpture and architecture
small glass or clay ball used as a toy in children's games
pattern or coloring resembling the veined appearance of marble stone
examples: The statue was carved from a single block of white marble
Italian marble adorned the floors of the luxury hotel
Children played marbles during recess at school
He kept his collection of antique marbles in a jar
The cake had beautiful marble swirls of chocolate and vanilla
She chose marble pattern countertops for the kitchen

definitions: organized walk by a group, especially soldiers or protesters, moving in formation
third month of the year in the Gregorian calendar
frontier or border region between territories or countries
examples: The protest march drew thousands of participants downtown
Soldiers completed a twenty-mile march in full gear
Spring officially begins in March in the Northern Hemisphere
Her birthday falls on the fifteenth of March
The Welsh Marches formed the border between England and Wales
Medieval lords controlled the march between the kingdoms

definitions: person who participates in an organized march or procession
examples: The marchers carried signs demanding justice and equality
Police estimated ten thousand marchers joined the demonstration
Civil rights marchers faced violence during the historic protest
The marchers maintained formation despite the heavy rain

definitions: act of walking with regular, measured steps, typically in formation
examples: The marching of the band could be heard from blocks away
Hours of marching practice prepared them for the parade
The marching continued despite the scorching heat
Precise marching requires coordination and discipline

definitions: adult female horse, typically over four years of age
examples: The mare gave birth to a healthy foal last spring
He rode his favorite mare in the competition
The breeding mare was valued at over fifty thousand dollars
Wild mares led their foals to the watering hole

definitions: spreadable food product made from vegetable oils, used as a substitute for butter
examples: She spread margarine on her toast instead of butter
The recipe calls for either butter or margarine
Low-fat margarine contains fewer calories than regular butter
Many bakers prefer butter to margarine for pastries

definitions: cocktail made with tequila, lime juice, and orange liqueur, often served with salt
examples: She ordered a frozen margarita with extra lime
The restaurant serves the best margaritas in town
They enjoyed margaritas by the pool during vacation
He preferred his margarita on the rocks without salt

definitions: informal shortened form of margarine, a butter substitute
examples: Pass the marge for the bread, please
She always kept marge in the fridge for cooking
The kids couldn't tell the difference between butter and marge
Budget-conscious shoppers often choose marge over butter

definitions: blank space around the edges of a page or document
difference between cost and selling price representing profit
amount or degree of difference providing room for error or safety
examples: Write your notes in the margin of the textbook
The printer settings left a one-inch margin on all sides
The company operates on very thin profit margins
Retailers need healthy margins to stay in business
She won the election by a narrow margin of votes
Engineers build bridges with a large safety margin

definitions: notes, comments, or illustrations written in the margins of a book or document
examples: The ancient manuscript contained fascinating marginalia from various readers
Scholars study marginalia to understand historical reading practices
Her marginalia revealed deep engagement with the philosophical text
The library's copy was filled with marginalia from previous students

definitions: process of treating a person or group as insignificant or pushing them to society's edge
examples: The marginalization of minority communities continues despite legal protections
Economic policies led to the marginalization of rural populations
They fought against the marginalization of disabled workers
Historical marginalization created lasting social inequalities

definitions: flowering plant with white petals and yellow center, commonly known as ox-eye daisy
examples: Marguerites bloomed abundantly in the meadow each summer
She planted marguerites along the garden border
The bouquet featured white marguerites and pink roses
Wild marguerites covered the hillside in spring

definitions: traditional Mexican musical group featuring violins, trumpets, guitars, and distinctive costumes
examples: The mariachi band played at the wedding reception
Mariachi music filled the plaza during the festival
He hired a mariachi group for his wife's birthday surprise
The mariachi performed traditional songs in elaborate charro outfits

definitions: bright orange or yellow flowering plant commonly used in gardens and ceremonies
examples: Marigolds bordered the vegetable garden to repel pests
The altar was decorated with orange marigolds
She planted marigolds every spring for their vibrant color
Marigolds are traditionally used in Day of the Dead celebrations

definitions: psychoactive drug from the cannabis plant used recreationally or medicinally
examples: Medical marijuana is legal in many states for certain conditions
Police discovered marijuana plants growing in the warehouse
The debate over marijuana legalization continues nationwide
Patients use marijuana to manage chronic pain symptoms

definitions: large wooden percussion instrument with resonators beneath bars struck with mallets
examples: She played a beautiful solo on the marimba
The marimba's warm tones filled the concert hall
Learning marimba requires excellent hand-eye coordination
The orchestra featured a marimba in the percussion section

definitions: harbor facility with moorings and supplies for yachts and small boats
examples: Their yacht was docked at the marina for the winter
The marina offers fuel, repairs, and overnight berths
Restaurants at the marina provide waterfront dining
The new marina can accommodate over two hundred boats

definitions: relating to or found in the sea or ocean environment
soldier serving in a naval infantry force, especially the U.S. Marine Corps
examples: Marine biologists study coral reef ecosystems
The marine environment faces threats from pollution
The marine completed basic training at Parris Island
Marines were deployed to secure the embassy

definitions: person who navigates or works on ships, especially as a profession
examples: Ancient mariners navigated by the stars
The old mariner shared tales of storms at sea
Experienced mariners know how to read weather patterns
The maritime museum honors famous mariners throughout history

definitions: puppet controlled from above by strings or wires attached to control bars
examples: The marionette danced gracefully as the puppeteer pulled the strings
Children watched the marionette show with fascination
Creating marionettes requires artistic skill and patience
The museum displayed antique marionettes from various cultures

definitions: visible impression, stain, or symbol on a surface
numerical or letter grade indicating performance or quality
target, goal, or standard to be achieved or reached
examples: The coffee cup left a mark on the wooden table
She made a mark on the calendar for the appointment
He received top marks on all his exams
The teacher gave her full marks for creativity
The arrow missed its mark by several inches
Sales exceeded the million-dollar mark last quarter

definitions: pen with felt tip used for writing or drawing, typically with permanent ink
object or sign that indicates position, boundary, or significant point
stone or post marking a boundary, grave, or commemorative site
examples: She used a red marker to highlight important passages
The whiteboard markers need to be replaced
The trail markers helped hikers stay on path
Genetic markers can indicate disease susceptibility
The historical marker commemorated the battle site
Property markers define the exact boundaries

definitions: physical location where goods are bought and sold
economic system of supply and demand for goods and services
demand for particular goods or services from consumers
examples: Farmers sell fresh produce at the weekend market
The fish market opens before dawn each day
Stock market volatility affected retirement portfolios
Free market principles guide the economy
There's a huge market for organic foods
Companies compete for the teenage market

definitions: person whose job involves promoting and selling products or services
examples: The marketer developed a new campaign for the product launch
Digital marketers focus on online advertising strategies
Successful marketers understand consumer psychology
The company hired experienced marketers to boost sales

definitions: activities and processes for promoting, selling, and distributing products or services
examples: The marketing department launched a social media campaign
Effective marketing increased brand awareness significantly
She studied marketing at business school
Online marketing has transformed retail businesses

definitions: physical area or building where goods are bought and sold
sphere of commercial activity and competition in business
examples: Vendors displayed their wares in the bustling marketplace
The ancient marketplace was the center of town life
Online marketplaces connect buyers and sellers globally
New products must compete in a crowded marketplace

definitions: pattern of marks or coloring on an animal, plant, or object
process of evaluating and grading academic work or examinations
examples: The leopard's markings provide camouflage in dappled sunlight
Road markings guide traffic flow and lane positions
Teachers spend weekends marking student essays
The marking scheme ensures consistent grading

definitions: person skilled in shooting, especially with rifles at targets
examples: The marksman hit the bullseye from two hundred yards
Police marksmen were positioned on nearby rooftops
She trained for years to become an expert marksman
The military recruits its best marksmen for special units

definitions: skill and ability in shooting accurately at targets
examples: His marksmanship earned him a place on the Olympic team
The course teaches basic marksmanship and gun safety
Excellent marksmanship requires steady hands and concentration
Military training emphasizes marksmanship under pressure

definitions: amount added to cost price to determine selling price
system of tags or codes used to format text in documents
examples: The store applies a fifty percent markup on jewelry
Retailers need adequate markup to cover overhead costs
HTML markup structures web page content
The editor added markup to indicate formatting changes

definitions: large oceanic game fish with elongated body and spear-like snout
examples: The fisherman struggled for hours to land the marlin
Blue marlin can reach speeds of fifty miles per hour
Sport fishing for marlin attracts tourists to coastal towns
The restaurant served grilled marlin with tropical salsa

definitions: fruit preserve made from citrus fruit, especially oranges, including peel
examples: She spread orange marmalade on her morning toast
Homemade marmalade contains chunks of citrus peel
The British traditionally enjoy marmalade at breakfast
Grandmother's secret marmalade recipe won prizes at fairs

definitions: small tropical American monkey with clawed digits and long tail
examples: The marmoset clung to tree branches with its tiny claws
Pygmy marmosets are the world's smallest monkeys
Researchers study marmoset social behavior in laboratories
The zoo's marmoset exhibit features several species

definitions: large ground-dwelling rodent found in mountainous areas, related to squirrels
examples: Alpine marmots hibernate through the long winter months
The marmot whistled to warn others of approaching danger
Hikers often spot marmots sunning on rocks
Yellow-bellied marmots are common in western mountains

definitions: dark brownish-red color resembling wine or chestnuts
act of abandoning someone in an isolated or inaccessible place
examples: The school uniform featured maroon blazers and grey trousers
She painted the dining room walls a rich maroon
The sailors were marooned on the desert island
The maroon of passengers lasted three days

definitions: brand name of a product, especially a luxury automobile
examples: The dealership sells several prestigious automotive marques
Ferrari remains one of the most recognized marques worldwide
Luxury marques command premium prices in the market
The company acquired the rights to the historic marque

definitions: projecting canopy over a theater entrance displaying show information
most prominent or distinguished position in entertainment or events
examples: The theater's marquee announced the new Broadway show
Bright lights illuminated the vintage cinema marquee
She finally achieved marquee status in Hollywood
The festival features several marquee performers

definitions: elongated oval cut for gemstones with pointed ends
wife or widow of a marquis, or woman holding the rank
examples: The engagement ring featured a marquise diamond
Marquise cut stones appear larger than round cuts
The marquise hosted elaborate parties at the château
Historical novels often feature a marquise as character

definitions: legally or formally recognized union between partners as spouses
close union or combination of different elements or things
examples: Their marriage lasted over fifty years
The marriage ceremony took place in a garden
The dish represents a perfect marriage of flavors
The merger created a marriage of two corporate cultures

definitions: people who are in a state of marriage; married individuals collectively
examples: The resort offers special packages for the newly married
The married often have different tax obligations
Social clubs for the married provide couple activities
The married comprised sixty percent of the survey respondents

definitions: soft fatty tissue found inside bones that produces blood cells
long green squash vegetable commonly grown in British gardens
essential or innermost part of something; the very essence
examples: Bone marrow transplants can treat certain cancers
The doctor extracted marrow for testing
She grew prize-winning marrows in her garden
Stuffed marrow makes a hearty vegetarian meal
The cold penetrated to the very marrow of his bones
Fear struck him to the marrow

definitions: area of low-lying wetland with grasses and reeds, often waterlogged
examples: Birds nest in the protected marsh during spring
The marsh provides habitat for numerous species
They built boardwalks through the marsh for visitors
Salt marshes line much of the eastern coastline

definitions: federal or municipal law enforcement officer with specific duties
high-ranking military officer in some countries
official responsible for organizing ceremonies or public events
examples: The federal marshal served the arrest warrant
Fire marshals investigate suspicious blazes
Field Marshal Montgomery led Allied forces
The marshal commanded respect from all troops
The parade marshal coordinated the procession route
Race marshals ensure competitor safety

definitions: alternative spelling of marshal, a law enforcement or military officer
examples: The marshall arrived to restore order in the town
Air Force marshalls provide security on flights
The marshall coordinated the emergency response
Town marshalls enforce local ordinances

definitions: area of land consisting of marshes and wetland habitat
examples: The marshland supports diverse wildlife populations
Developers cannot build on protected marshland
Ancient peoples settled near fertile marshland
Marshland filters pollutants from water naturally

definitions: soft spongy confection made from sugar, gelatin, and corn syrup
plant growing in marshes whose root was originally used to make the confection
examples: Children roasted marshmallows over the campfire
Hot chocolate tastes better with marshmallows on top
The marshmallow plant has medicinal properties
Wild marshmallow grows near wetlands
